definitions.definition: Subsidence of the roof of a coal mine.
An event, usually lasting one full day or more, where the primary goal is to sit in meditation.
(of a person) To be in a position in which the upper body is upright and supported by the buttocks.
definitions.example: After a long day of walking, it was good just to sit and relax.

definitions.definition: (of a person) To move oneself into such a position.
(of an object) To occupy a given position permanently.
definitions.example: The temple has sat atop that hill for centuries.

definitions.definition: To remain in a state of repose; to rest; to abide; to rest in any position or condition.
To be a member of a deliberative body.
definitions.example: I currently sit on a standards committee.

definitions.definition: Of a legislative or, especially, a judicial body such as a court, to be in session.
definitions.example: In what city is the circuit court sitting for this session.

definitions.definition: To lie, rest, or bear; to press or weigh.
(of an agreement or arrangement) To be accepted or acceptable; to work.
definitions.example: How will this new contract sit with the workers?

definitions.definition: (causative) To cause to be seated or in a sitting posture; to furnish a seat to.
definitions.example: Sit him in front of the TV and he might watch for hours.

definitions.definition: To accommodate in seats; to seat.
definitions.example: The dining room table sits eight comfortably.
I need to find someone to sit my kids on Friday evening for four hours.

definitions.definition: To take, to undergo or complete (an examination or test).
To cover and warm eggs for hatching, as a fowl; to brood; to incubate.
To take a position for the purpose of having some artistic representation of oneself made, such as a picture or a bust.
definitions.example: I'm sitting for a painter this evening.

definitions.definition: To have position, as at the point blown from; to hold a relative position; to have direction.
